reasons_to_visit.details: Witness the UNESCO Lavaux vineyard terraces come alive with fresh green shoots. April offers stunning walks or bike rides with fewer crowds than summer, overlooking Lake Geneva.
Enjoy milder temperatures perfect for walking along the Ouchy waterfront, visiting the Olympic Museum park, and seeing the lake awaken after winter.
Potentially catch the end of the Cully Jazz Festival (early April) in the vineyards or visit the vibrant Morges Tulip Festival (late March-early May) nearby.
Experience Lausanne's attractions like the Cathedral, Old Town (La Cité), and museums (Olympic, Art Brut) with moderate crowds and potentially lower accommodation costs than peak season.
April typically marks the start of the regular CGN boat cruise schedule on Lake Geneva, offering scenic trips towards Montreux, Geneva, or Evian (France).
See Lausanne's parks, like Parc de Mon Repos or the Botanical Garden, begin to bloom with spring flowers, offering pleasant spots for relaxation.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: April is notorious for unpredictable weather – sunshine, rain, wind, and even late snow showers are possible, sometimes all in one day. Packing layers is essential.
While scenic, Lake Geneva is far too cold for swimming or most watersports in April. Stick to lakeside walks and cruises.
If Easter falls in April, expect closures or reduced hours for shops and some services on Good Friday, Easter Sunday/Monday. Major attractions usually open, but check ahead.
April is a peak month for tree pollen (especially birch), which can significantly affect allergy sufferers. Check pollen forecasts if sensitive.
While lower Lavaux paths are fine, higher trails in the nearby Prealps or Jura might still be snowy, muddy, or closed for the season.
While picturesque, be aware that April is an active time in the vineyards, so you might encounter workers and machinery on some paths.

weather.precipitation: Very unpredictable. Mix of bright sunny days, overcast periods, and frequent rain showers. Possibility of cold snaps or even wet snow.
weather.general_tips: Crucial to pack layers: waterproof jacket, fleece/sweater, t-shirts, comfortable walking shoes (water-resistant helpful), umbrella. Sunglasses needed for sunny spells.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate shoulder season. Generally pleasant, but can increase significantly if Easter falls during this period or during Cully Jazz Festival.
tourism_level.pricing: Mid-range. Accommodation generally cheaper than summer, but prices can spike around Easter/festivals. Book ahead if dates coincide.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City waking up for spring. Outdoor cafe seating appears, parks greening up, but still relatively quiet compared to summer. Can feel vibrant during festival days.

events_holidays.name: Cully Jazz Festival (Potential End Dates)
events_holidays.date: Typically ends early April (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Internationally renowned jazz festival held in the wine cellars and streets of Cully village in Lavaux. Even if missing the main concerts, the atmosphere in the village can be enjoyable.
events_holidays.notes: Check the festival schedule well in advance. Access to Cully via train from Lausanne. Village gets very busy.

events_holidays.name: Morges Tulip Festival (Fête de la Tulipe)
events_holidays.date: Starts late March/early April, runs into May
events_holidays.description: Spectacular display of thousands of tulips in Parc de l'Indépendance in Morges, a short train ride from Lausanne.
events_holidays.notes: Peak bloom varies yearly. Weekdays less crowded. Check SBB for train times to Morges.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Pâques)
events_holidays.description: Includes Good Friday (Vendredi Saint), Easter Sunday (Dimanche de Pâques), Easter Monday (Lundi de Pâques). Religious services, special brunches, chocolate shops busy.
events_holidays.notes: Good Friday & Easter Monday are public holidays in Vaud. Most shops closed, main attractions/restaurants open. Check specific opening hours.

unique_experiences.where: UNESCO World Heritage Site, e.g., Lutry to Cully or St-Saphorin
unique_experiences.description: Experience the stunning vineyard terraces as they begin to green. Enjoy breathtaking views over Lake Geneva and the Alps. Stick to lower, well-maintained paths.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear sturdy shoes, paths can be uneven. Check train schedules (e.g., SBB app) for getting to/from villages like Lutry, Cully, St-Saphorin. Bring water.
unique_experiences.best_time: Sunny days for best views and path conditions.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the history of the Games through interactive exhibits, memorabilia, and films. The surrounding park offers sculptures and lake views.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 2-3 hours. Consider buying tickets online. Accessible via metro (M2 to Ouchy-Olympique). Good option for a rainy day.

unique_experiences.where: Lakefront promenade from Port d'Ouchy towards Pully or Vidy
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a leisurely walk along Lake Geneva, see the marina, Château d'Ouchy, and watch the boats. Cafes start opening their terraces.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Flat and easy walk. Can be combined with the Olympic Museum visit. Can get windy, bring a jacket.

unique_experiences.activity: Explore Lausanne Old Town (La Cité) & Cathedral
unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic core, climb the Cathedral towers for panoramic views (check opening), see Place de la Palud and the Château Saint-Maire.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Involves steep streets and stairs (Escaliers du Marché). Wear comfortable shoes. Cathedral visit is free, tower climb has a fee.
unique_experiences.best_time: Daytime. Cathedral interior best during visiting hours.
unique_experiences.estimated_cost: Free (small fee for Cathedral tower access)

weather.precipitation: Still very mixed. Can have beautiful warm, sunny spells, but cold, rainy days are equally possible. Snowfall less likely but not impossible.
weather.general_tips: Layering remains key. Don't be fooled by a sunny morning; pack for potential rain and cooler temperatures, especially in the evenings.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate. Generally quieter than Easter period (if it fell earlier) but steadily picks up towards May.
tourism_level.pricing: Mid-range. Good time to find deals before the main season starts, unless overlapping with a specific event.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: More reliably spring-like. Parks are greener, more flowers blooming, outdoor activities become more appealing on good weather days.

events_holidays.name: Morges Tulip Festival (Ongoing)
events_holidays.description: Continue enjoying the tulip displays in Morges. Peak bloom often occurs mid-to-late April depending on the weather.
events_holidays.notes: Easy day trip from Lausanne by train.

events_holidays.name: Luna Park Lausanne (Potential Start)
events_holidays.date: Often starts mid/late April (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Annual funfair sets up at Place Bellerive in Ouchy, offering rides, games, and food stalls.
events_holidays.notes: Check local listings for exact dates and opening hours. Can be noisy in the evenings.

events_holidays.name: Start of Regular Lake Cruise Season
events_holidays.description: More frequent boat services on Lake Geneva (CGN) become available, offering wider choices for scenic cruises.
events_holidays.notes: Check the CGN website for the spring timetable.

unique_experiences.activity: Day Trip to Morges for Tulip Festival
unique_experiences.description: Take a short train ride to Morges to witness the stunning display of tulips in Parc de l'Indépendance by the lake.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Combine with a walk along Morges' lakeside promenade and a visit to its castle (exterior). Train takes ~10-15 mins.
unique_experiences.best_time: Midday on a sunny day for best flower viewing.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the fascinating museum dedicated to 'outsider art' created by self-taught artists, often outside established art circuits. Unique and thought-provoking.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 1.5-2 hours. Located slightly uphill from the center, accessible by bus. Free entry first Saturday of the month.

unique_experiences.activity: Take a Scenic Lake Geneva Cruise
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a boat trip on Lake Geneva with the expanding spring schedule. Options include shorter loops or longer trips towards Montreux or Geneva, offering views of vineyards, castles, and the Alps.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check CGN schedule online. Dress warmly (wind on the lake). Consider routes showcasing Lavaux or Chillon Castle (near Montreux).

unique_experiences.activity: Hike or Relax at Sauvabelin Park & Tower
unique_experiences.description: Explore the Sauvabelin forest park, see the small lake and animal enclosures, and climb the wooden Sauvabelin Tower (free access) for panoramic views over the city, lake, and Alps.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by bus (e.g., No. 16 to Lac Sauvabelin). Tower climb involves stairs. Good spot for families or a shorter nature walk.
unique_experiences.best_time: Clear days for best views from the tower.

unique_experiences.where: Various locations (e.g., Place de la Riponne, Place de la Palud)
unique_experiences.description: Explore Lausanne's outdoor markets, typically held on Wednesday and Saturday mornings, offering fresh produce, local cheeses, flowers, and crafts.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bring cash. Check specific market days and locations. Place de la Riponne market is larger.
